text: I've just spoken to @Douglas4Moray and congratulated him on becoming leader of the @ScotTories. I look forward to working with Douglas to promote Scotland's place in our United Kingdom  https://t.co/Q5VC6nuv3I
english: I've just spoken to @Douglas4Moray and congratulated him on becoming leader of the @ScotTories. I look forward to working with Douglas to promote Scotland's place in our United Kingdom  https://t.co/Q5VC6nuv3I

text: Tonight a candle has been lit in memory of John Hume and placed in the door of Downing Street. A symbol to all of us of the peace he was so instrumental in securing, and a reminder of the long-lasting impact he had on the world. #JohnsLight https://t.co/jby5TZQYER
english: Tonight a candle has been lit in memory of John Hume and placed in the door of Downing Street. A symbol to all of us of the peace he was so instrumental in securing, and a reminder of the long-lasting impact he had on the world. #JohnsLight https://t.co/jby5TZQYER

text: The pictures and videos from Beirut tonight are shocking. All of my thoughts and prayers are with those caught up in this terrible incident. The UK is ready to provide support in any way we can, including to those British nationals affected.
english: The pictures and videos from Beirut tonight are shocking. All of my thoughts and prayers are with those caught up in this terrible incident. The UK is ready to provide support in any way we can, including to those British nationals affected.

text: Fantastic to see that tens of thousands of new homes and other vital infrastructure projects have today been given the green light, with nearly £1.3bn of investment. https://t.co/fI6nAJZgeH
english: Fantastic to see that tens of thousands of new homes and other vital infrastructure projects have today been given the green light, with nearly £1.3bn of investment. https://t.co/fI6nAJZgeH

text: John Hume was quite simply a political giant. He stood proudly in the tradition that was totally opposed to violence and committed to pursuing his objectives by exclusively peaceful and democratic means.
english: John Hume was quite simply a political giant. He stood proudly in the tradition that was totally opposed to violence and committed to pursuing his objectives by exclusively peaceful and democratic means.

text: Yorkshire - the home of Yorkshire tea, the beautiful Yorkshire Dales and some of the friendliest people in the UK. Have a fantastic Yorkshire Day everybody! #YorkshireDay
english: Yorkshire - the home of Yorkshire tea, the beautiful Yorkshire Dales and some of the friendliest people in the UK. Have a fantastic Yorkshire Day everybody! #YorkshireDay

text: Folks, if we all remember to do these three things, then we can keep the virus under control.  Wash your hands, cover your face, and keep your space from those not in your household.   #HandsFaceSpace https://t.co/uBuxvvnWKV
english: Folks, if we all remember to do these three things, then we can keep the virus under control.  Wash your hands, cover your face, and keep your space from those not in your household.   #HandsFaceSpace https://t.co/uBuxvvnWKV

text: In order to keep the virus under control, we’re postponing some of the changes we were hoping to make in August.   Read my full statement: https://t.co/JBrhBXFr3b https://t.co/ZL7a9tsqkU
english: In order to keep the virus under control, we’re postponing some of the changes we were hoping to make in August.   Read my full statement: https://t.co/JBrhBXFr3b https://t.co/ZL7a9tsqkU

text: There are some very simple ways we can all protect ourselves and others from the spread of coronavirus.   Wash your hands, cover your face & make space. #HandsFaceSpace https://t.co/C1RHeRVvcr
english: There are some very simple ways we can all protect ourselves and others from the spread of coronavirus.   Wash your hands, cover your face & make space. #HandsFaceSpace https://t.co/C1RHeRVvcr

text: Today I visited North Yorkshire Police to thank them for their hard work throughout the pandemic, and to meet with new recruits.   Police work diligently every day to keep us safe, and I want to thank all new recruits for joining the service and being part of this heroic effort. https://t.co/dxOLMz1ULO
english: Today I visited North Yorkshire Police to thank them for their hard work throughout the pandemic, and to meet with new recruits.   Police work diligently every day to keep us safe, and I want to thank all new recruits for joining the service and being part of this heroic effort. https://t.co/dxOLMz1ULO

text: I want to wish Muslims here in the UK and around the world the very best for Eid al-Adha.   #EidMubarak https://t.co/VG8f6p0qy2
english: I want to wish Muslims here in the UK and around the world the very best for Eid al-Adha.   #EidMubarak https://t.co/VG8f6p0qy2

text: We’re going to make it easier than ever to cycle around, with new cycle routes and vouchers for bike repairs.   Together we can reduce the pollution and noise on our streets, and move towards a cleaner, greener Britain. https://t.co/lcxbYmpt9z
english: We’re going to make it easier than ever to cycle around, with new cycle routes and vouchers for bike repairs.   Together we can reduce the pollution and noise on our streets, and move towards a cleaner, greener Britain. https://t.co/lcxbYmpt9z

text: Cycling and walking have a huge role in tackling some of the health and environmental challenges that we face.   Our £2bn cycling strategy will encourage more cycling with thousands of miles of new bike lanes, and training for those who want to learn. https://t.co/PwYtqXpdd1
english: Cycling and walking have a huge role in tackling some of the health and environmental challenges that we face.   Our £2bn cycling strategy will encourage more cycling with thousands of miles of new bike lanes, and training for those who want to learn. https://t.co/PwYtqXpdd1

text: Losing weight is hard but with some small changes we can all feel fitter and healthier.  If we all do our bit, we can reduce our health risks and protect ourselves against coronavirus – as well as taking pressure off the NHS.   Our Better Health Strategy https://t.co/WdazXhuhRN https://t.co/KZhW8p17FJ
english: Losing weight is hard but with some small changes we can all feel fitter and healthier.  If we all do our bit, we can reduce our health risks and protect ourselves against coronavirus – as well as taking pressure off the NHS.   Our Better Health Strategy https://t.co/WdazXhuhRN https://t.co/KZhW8p17FJ

text: When I entered Downing Street, I pledged to support our teachers, nurses and police.  Thank you to Emma @sussex_police, Hollie @NandM_Keele, Vicky @WandleEnglish, and all our fantastic public servants who make this country the best place in the world to live. https://t.co/5J47WTqE3H
english: When I entered Downing Street, I pledged to support our teachers, nurses and police.  Thank you to Emma @sussex_police, Hollie @NandM_Keele, Vicky @WandleEnglish, and all our fantastic public servants who make this country the best place in the world to live. https://t.co/5J47WTqE3H

text: I took on the challenge of listing as many of the government’s achievements as possible within 2 minutes. Watch how I did here. https://t.co/VckidX8szp
english: I took on the challenge of listing as many of the government’s achievements as possible within 2 minutes. Watch how I did here. https://t.co/VckidX8szp

text: A year ago, I stood on the steps of Downing Street and pledged to get Brexit done, and unite and level up the country.   It’s been a year of extraordinary and unprecedented challenges. But I believe we can be proud of our country and what we’ve achieved together  https://t.co/iOuJ2xPCww
english: A year ago, I stood on the steps of Downing Street and pledged to get Brexit done, and unite and level up the country.   It’s been a year of extraordinary and unprecedented challenges. But I believe we can be proud of our country and what we’ve achieved together  https://t.co/iOuJ2xPCww

text: Today we've announced the roll out of the most comprehensive programme of free flu vaccines, making these available for more people than ever before. It's so important that we all get the flu vaccine, to protect ourselves and our NHS. https://t.co/9h3WK1d3gB
english: Today we've announced the roll out of the most comprehensive programme of free flu vaccines, making these available for more people than ever before. It's so important that we all get the flu vaccine, to protect ourselves and our NHS. https://t.co/9h3WK1d3gB

text: We've got a fantastic, strong, united country. We're going to bounce forward together, stronger together. https://t.co/uLvfm9NTse
english: We've got a fantastic, strong, united country. We're going to bounce forward together, stronger together. https://t.co/uLvfm9NTse

text: While our brilliant @TeamGB athletes will have to wait another year for their chance at Olympic glory, I know that come next year, they will be ready to take Tokyo by storm! Bring it on   #OneYearToGo #Tokyo2020 https://t.co/4zDHJw1oYP
english: While our brilliant @TeamGB athletes will have to wait another year for their chance at Olympic glory, I know that come next year, they will be ready to take Tokyo by storm! Bring it on   #OneYearToGo #Tokyo2020 https://t.co/4zDHJw1oYP

text: It's a year since I stood on the steps of Downing St as the Prime Minister of this great country.    In the face of so many challenges this year, we can be proud of what we have achieved together.    We will continue to deliver on the people's priorities  https://t.co/F8UIuPdylh
english: It's a year since I stood on the steps of Downing St as the Prime Minister of this great country.    In the face of so many challenges this year, we can be proud of what we have achieved together.    We will continue to deliver on the people's priorities  https://t.co/F8UIuPdylh

text: Yesterday I chaired the first meeting of our new Commission on Race and Ethnic Disparities.    Thank you to all the members - I hope this will really make the difference that we need right now. https://t.co/aQ20l97sMT
english: Yesterday I chaired the first meeting of our new Commission on Race and Ethnic Disparities.    Thank you to all the members - I hope this will really make the difference that we need right now. https://t.co/aQ20l97sMT

text: We’ve made great strides towards our net zero target over the last year, but it’s more important than ever that we keep up the pace of change to fuel a green, sustainable recovery as we rebuild from the pandemic. https://t.co/Z76xmidz03
english: We’ve made great strides towards our net zero target over the last year, but it’s more important than ever that we keep up the pace of change to fuel a green, sustainable recovery as we rebuild from the pandemic. https://t.co/Z76xmidz03

text: It was a pleasure to welcome @SecPompeo to Downing Street today. We reaffirmed our countries’ strong relationship and commitment to working together on the fight against coronavirus, shared security concerns and a UK-US free trade agreement.  https://t.co/HJD8Z8m0IT
english: It was a pleasure to welcome @SecPompeo to Downing Street today. We reaffirmed our countries’ strong relationship and commitment to working together on the fight against coronavirus, shared security concerns and a UK-US free trade agreement.  https://t.co/HJD8Z8m0IT

text: We’ve kept our promises. We have recruited thousands of nurses & police officers, and invested billions more in our NHS & schools.    Of course there is much more to do. As we begin to recover from this pandemic, we will not lose sight of the country we have promised to build  https://t.co/ycz2pv0T3q
english: We’ve kept our promises. We have recruited thousands of nurses & police officers, and invested billions more in our NHS & schools.    Of course there is much more to do. As we begin to recover from this pandemic, we will not lose sight of the country we have promised to build  https://t.co/ycz2pv0T3q

text: I was delighted to meet with students & teachers at the Discovery Primary School yesterday.    We’ve announced a £2.2bn package to help teachers support those who may have fallen behind, and to deliver a superb education for every student. https://t.co/WJH3WglXks
english: I was delighted to meet with students & teachers at the Discovery Primary School yesterday.    We’ve announced a £2.2bn package to help teachers support those who may have fallen behind, and to deliver a superb education for every student. https://t.co/WJH3WglXks

text: Our teachers, doctors, armed forces personnel, and public sector workers have responded to the unprecedented challenges of coronavirus.    To recognise their efforts on the front line, we will be increasing their pay this year. https://t.co/tnPA46Whvs
english: Our teachers, doctors, armed forces personnel, and public sector workers have responded to the unprecedented challenges of coronavirus.    To recognise their efforts on the front line, we will be increasing their pay this year. https://t.co/tnPA46Whvs

text: This is very positive news. A huge well done to our brilliant, world-leading scientists & researchers at @UniofOxford.  There are no guarantees, we’re not there yet & further trials will be necessary - but this is an important step in the right direction. https://t.co/PRUTu8rlPF
english: This is very positive news. A huge well done to our brilliant, world-leading scientists & researchers at @UniofOxford.  There are no guarantees, we’re not there yet & further trials will be necessary - but this is an important step in the right direction. https://t.co/PRUTu8rlPF

text: I’m here today visiting Discovery Primary School in Kent, where I’ve been speaking with students and teachers.    We’re delivering on our promise to increase per pupil funding for every student, with an additional £2.2 billion funding boost for schools in England. https://t.co/5RTuX70XUM
english: I’m here today visiting Discovery Primary School in Kent, where I’ve been speaking with students and teachers.    We’re delivering on our promise to increase per pupil funding for every student, with an additional £2.2 billion funding boost for schools in England. https://t.co/5RTuX70XUM

text: As our lives slowly return to normal, there are some precautions we must take. From next Friday in England, we must all wear a face covering in shops and supermarkets, as well as on public transport. This will protect others and help stop the spread.
english: As our lives slowly return to normal, there are some precautions we must take. From next Friday in England, we must all wear a face covering in shops and supermarkets, as well as on public transport. This will protect others and help stop the spread.

text: We're making sure the NHS has the resources it needs to prepare for winter. But even as we plan for the worst, I strongly believe we should also hope for the best. https://t.co/pRJahCvEpP
english: We're making sure the NHS has the resources it needs to prepare for winter. But even as we plan for the worst, I strongly believe we should also hope for the best. https://t.co/pRJahCvEpP

text: This weekend, many of us will be seeing friends, going to the pub or going out to restaurants. As we open the economy back up, we must remember to follow social distancing guidelines. Keep yourself, your family and your community safe.
english: This weekend, many of us will be seeing friends, going to the pub or going out to restaurants. As we open the economy back up, we must remember to follow social distancing guidelines. Keep yourself, your family and your community safe.

text: 1: Our understanding of the epidemiology of coronavirus and intelligence on where it is spreading has vastly improved. This means we can control it through targeted, local action.
english: 1: Our understanding of the epidemiology of coronavirus and intelligence on where it is spreading has vastly improved. This means we can control it through targeted, local action.

text: Today I announced the next chapter in our coronavirus recovery strategy.  Read my full statement here: https://t.co/uuziwLkUih https://t.co/CslhJ1uSeU
english: Today I announced the next chapter in our coronavirus recovery strategy.  Read my full statement here: https://t.co/uuziwLkUih https://t.co/CslhJ1uSeU

text: Arise Sir Tom! So richly deserved - you have inspired the whole nation with your fantastic fundraising efforts. @captaintommoore  https://t.co/TwxlmuPdiy
english: Arise Sir Tom! So richly deserved - you have inspired the whole nation with your fantastic fundraising efforts. @captaintommoore  https://t.co/TwxlmuPdiy

text: Today I have announced the next stage in the UK Government's coronavirus recovery strategy.  Read my full statement here: https://t.co/uuziwLkUih https://t.co/bqIU2oHYbd
english: Today I have announced the next stage in the UK Government's coronavirus recovery strategy.  Read my full statement here: https://t.co/uuziwLkUih https://t.co/bqIU2oHYbd

text: We're getting on with delivering our agenda for the country and taking it forward.   We'll do absolutely everything in our power to prevent a second spike which could overwhelm the NHS. https://t.co/1gZpPhNN1v
english: We're getting on with delivering our agenda for the country and taking it forward.   We'll do absolutely everything in our power to prevent a second spike which could overwhelm the NHS. https://t.co/1gZpPhNN1v

text: Yesterday I spoke to the incredible staff at the London Ambulance Service, who work so hard to save lives.   Thank you to all the ambulance staff across the UK, for all of your hard work and support throughout this pandemic. https://t.co/fOgm4Rt2sI
english: Yesterday I spoke to the incredible staff at the London Ambulance Service, who work so hard to save lives.   Thank you to all the ambulance staff across the UK, for all of your hard work and support throughout this pandemic. https://t.co/fOgm4Rt2sI

text: Congratulations to @AndrzejDuda on your re-election as President of Poland. The UK and Poland have a long, shared history and friendship in Europe, NATO and elsewhere. I look forward to that continuing as we face the challenges and opportunities ahead.
english: Congratulations to @AndrzejDuda on your re-election as President of Poland. The UK and Poland have a long, shared history and friendship in Europe, NATO and elsewhere. I look forward to that continuing as we face the challenges and opportunities ahead.

text: Today I visited the London Ambulance Service to thank them for all their work during the coronavirus pandemic.   We're introducing tougher penalties for aggressive and violent behaviour towards emergency services workers – protecting those who care for us in our time of need. https://t.co/R2hkcCsWRY
english: Today I visited the London Ambulance Service to thank them for all their work during the coronavirus pandemic.   We're introducing tougher penalties for aggressive and violent behaviour towards emergency services workers – protecting those who care for us in our time of need. https://t.co/R2hkcCsWRY

text: It was fantastic to be back answering your questions at #PeoplesPMQs yesterday.  You can watch the full episode here: https://t.co/uFlRotPZeO https://t.co/DOBzbwcwFH
english: It was fantastic to be back answering your questions at #PeoplesPMQs yesterday.  You can watch the full episode here: https://t.co/uFlRotPZeO https://t.co/DOBzbwcwFH

text: As we return to the many pubs, restaurants and sports grounds that we love, we must continue to follow the COVID Secure guidelines.   They may take some time to get used to, but by observing them we are all doing our bit to keep ourselves, our families and our communities safe.
english: As we return to the many pubs, restaurants and sports grounds that we love, we must continue to follow the COVID Secure guidelines.   They may take some time to get used to, but by observing them we are all doing our bit to keep ourselves, our families and our communities safe.

text: Jack Charlton was a football great whose achievements brought happiness to so many. My sympathies are with his family and friends.
english: Jack Charlton was a football great whose achievements brought happiness to so many. My sympathies are with his family and friends.

text: Police are always there for us, protecting our neighbourhoods and putting themselves at risk so that we can be safe. It’s a job that demands true courage, perseverance and devotion to others.    I’m delighted that so many have answered the call to serve. https://t.co/OJuj0CZmmK
english: Police are always there for us, protecting our neighbourhoods and putting themselves at risk so that we can be safe. It’s a job that demands true courage, perseverance and devotion to others.    I’m delighted that so many have answered the call to serve. https://t.co/OJuj0CZmmK

text: 25 years ago, Europe witnessed the worst atrocity on its soil since the Second World War - the genocide in Srebrenica, Bosnia.  Today we mourn and remember the victims of those terrible crimes and stand with the families in their fight for justice.  #Srebrenica25 https://t.co/YqZaYeUz9F
english: 25 years ago, Europe witnessed the worst atrocity on its soil since the Second World War - the genocide in Srebrenica, Bosnia.  Today we mourn and remember the victims of those terrible crimes and stand with the families in their fight for justice.  #Srebrenica25 https://t.co/YqZaYeUz9F

text: A farewell befitting a truly great Briton, whose voice and charm will live on to lift the hearts of generations to come. https://t.co/IDHcfm3akX
english: A farewell befitting a truly great Briton, whose voice and charm will live on to lift the hearts of generations to come. https://t.co/IDHcfm3akX

text: It was great to visit some local businesses in Uxbridge today, and see how they’ve been working hard to make their premises COVID-19 Secure.   If you’re out this weekend be sure to follow the guidelines on social distancing. #StayAlert https://t.co/54eCyvOa9D
english: It was great to visit some local businesses in Uxbridge today, and see how they’ve been working hard to make their premises COVID-19 Secure.   If you’re out this weekend be sure to follow the guidelines on social distancing. #StayAlert https://t.co/54eCyvOa9D

text: Watch me answer your questions in the latest #PeoplesPMQs https://t.co/yVf6C6apxD
english: Watch me answer your questions in the latest #PeoplesPMQs https://t.co/yVf6C6apxD

text: 80 years ago today our brave airmen took to the skies to defend this country. It was these few, as Churchill said, who turned the tide of the war and defended these islands from fascism and tyranny.   Today we remember their bravery and sacrifice. #BattleOfBritain https://t.co/DGEZur1vJh
english: 80 years ago today our brave airmen took to the skies to defend this country. It was these few, as Churchill said, who turned the tide of the war and defended these islands from fascism and tyranny.   Today we remember their bravery and sacrifice. #BattleOfBritain https://t.co/DGEZur1vJh

text: Your final months of school have coincided with the greatest crisis our country has faced since the Second World War. Thanks to your sacrifice, we have saved hundreds of thousands of lives.    And we can’t wait to see the new world that you’re going to help us to build. https://t.co/qY9IXFN2ZX
english: Your final months of school have coincided with the greatest crisis our country has faced since the Second World War. Thanks to your sacrifice, we have saved hundreds of thousands of lives.    And we can’t wait to see the new world that you’re going to help us to build. https://t.co/qY9IXFN2ZX

text: Tomorrow I’ll be hosting another episode of the #PeoplesPMQs.    Send me your questions here: https://t.co/lZOlW960OF https://t.co/ybK17NjvPq
english: Tomorrow I’ll be hosting another episode of the #PeoplesPMQs.    Send me your questions here: https://t.co/lZOlW960OF https://t.co/ybK17NjvPq

text: I’m delighted to see record numbers of nurses and midwives now working in our NHS as we work towards delivering 50,000 more nurses in this parliament.  Nurses have saved countless lives during the pandemic and we are so grateful for all that they do for us, and for our NHS. https://t.co/8zIcxqEXEe
english: I’m delighted to see record numbers of nurses and midwives now working in our NHS as we work towards delivering 50,000 more nurses in this parliament.  Nurses have saved countless lives during the pandemic and we are so grateful for all that they do for us, and for our NHS. https://t.co/8zIcxqEXEe

text: No one who was in London on 7 July 2005 will ever forget what they experienced that day.   As we remember those who were lost and pledge once again to support those who survived, our message is as clear and simple as it was 15 years ago.  We are not afraid. https://t.co/Folc8NRydk
english: No one who was in London on 7 July 2005 will ever forget what they experienced that day.   As we remember those who were lost and pledge once again to support those who survived, our message is as clear and simple as it was 15 years ago.  We are not afraid. https://t.co/Folc8NRydk

text: Over the weekend I welcomed staff from St Thomas’ hospital who looked after me whilst I had coronavirus at Downing Street.  It was wonderful to celebrate the NHS’s 72nd birthday with some of those who have done so much in the fight against the virus. https://t.co/4NE7ECc5Kl
english: Over the weekend I welcomed staff from St Thomas’ hospital who looked after me whilst I had coronavirus at Downing Street.  It was wonderful to celebrate the NHS’s 72nd birthday with some of those who have done so much in the fight against the virus. https://t.co/4NE7ECc5Kl

text: We’ve announced a £1.57 billion package to support our brilliant theatre and creative sectors.  There will have to be some creativity in making our theatres COVID-19 Secure, but we can do it and we’re working very hard with the sector to get it done. https://t.co/edbdxyttIy
english: We’ve announced a £1.57 billion package to support our brilliant theatre and creative sectors.  There will have to be some creativity in making our theatres COVID-19 Secure, but we can do it and we’re working very hard with the sector to get it done. https://t.co/edbdxyttIy

text: Today we remember all those who lost their lives in the London bombings, 15 years ago.    My heart goes out to all those who were there that day, living still with the memory of those horrific events, and all those grieving loved ones.
english: Today we remember all those who lost their lives in the London bombings, 15 years ago.    My heart goes out to all those who were there that day, living still with the memory of those horrific events, and all those grieving loved ones.

text: Today I visited the site of a new factory in East Yorkshire which will be building tube trains for the London Underground. This project will create over 2,000 jobs and is just one example of how we're using infrastructure, technology and education to unite & level up our country. https://t.co/Xh1OP84Ovt
english: Today I visited the site of a new factory in East Yorkshire which will be building tube trains for the London Underground. This project will create over 2,000 jobs and is just one example of how we're using infrastructure, technology and education to unite & level up our country. https://t.co/Xh1OP84Ovt

text: This evening I was honoured to host those who looked after me at St Thomas’ Hospital at Downing Street, as we celebrate 72 years of our incredible NHS. https://t.co/6LGAzAXZI5
english: This evening I was honoured to host those who looked after me at St Thomas’ Hospital at Downing Street, as we celebrate 72 years of our incredible NHS. https://t.co/6LGAzAXZI5

text: Thank you to the whole NHS family and all of our carers for all you have done and continue to do to keep us well and cared for.   In these past few months, indeed the past 72 years, you have represented the very best of this country. Our gratitude to you will be eternal. #NHS72 https://t.co/h4aWPO9YNT
english: Thank you to the whole NHS family and all of our carers for all you have done and continue to do to keep us well and cared for.   In these past few months, indeed the past 72 years, you have represented the very best of this country. Our gratitude to you will be eternal. #NHS72 https://t.co/h4aWPO9YNT

text: We will not just bounce back, we will bounce forward. Stronger, better and more united than ever before. https://t.co/2WUkozXsRP
english: We will not just bounce back, we will bounce forward. Stronger, better and more united than ever before. https://t.co/2WUkozXsRP

text: A very happy birthday to our National Health Service!  #ThankYouNHS https://t.co/4169rjNPn2
english: A very happy birthday to our National Health Service!  #ThankYouNHS https://t.co/4169rjNPn2

text: The NHS represents the very best of us and we will always be there to support it. https://t.co/9LlBSYaosr
english: The NHS represents the very best of us and we will always be there to support it. https://t.co/9LlBSYaosr

text: As pubs and restaurants open across England today, it’s absolutely vital that everyone follows the rules on social distancing.  We’ve worked so hard and together saved so many lives.  Stick to the rules this weekend, keep apart from others and wash your hands several times a day.
english: As pubs and restaurants open across England today, it’s absolutely vital that everyone follows the rules on social distancing.  We’ve worked so hard and together saved so many lives.  Stick to the rules this weekend, keep apart from others and wash your hands several times a day.

text: Places of worship are at the heart of so many communities, which is why I am delighted that thousands of churches, mosques, synagogues, gurdwaras and temples are preparing to welcome back their congregations safely for communal prayer and religious practice.
english: Places of worship are at the heart of so many communities, which is why I am delighted that thousands of churches, mosques, synagogues, gurdwaras and temples are preparing to welcome back their congregations safely for communal prayer and religious practice.

text: Our goal remains to enable as many people as possible to live their lives as close to normally as possible in a way which is as fair and as safe as possible. https://t.co/q6SMGxtNst
english: Our goal remains to enable as many people as possible to live their lives as close to normally as possible in a way which is as fair and as safe as possible. https://t.co/q6SMGxtNst

text: Let’s all stay alert, control the virus, save lives – and enjoy summer safely. https://t.co/KTN2uWnEU8
english: Let’s all stay alert, control the virus, save lives – and enjoy summer safely. https://t.co/KTN2uWnEU8

text: As we cautiously come out of hibernation, it is absolutely vital for us to set out the way ahead.   We are launching a ten-year plan to build more schools and facilities, and reforming the planning system so that we can build the homes we need. https://t.co/05rblZEdbp
english: As we cautiously come out of hibernation, it is absolutely vital for us to set out the way ahead.   We are launching a ten-year plan to build more schools and facilities, and reforming the planning system so that we can build the homes we need. https://t.co/05rblZEdbp

text: Today I spoke to business leaders who are supporting the government's #EnjoySummerSafely campaign.   As more hospitality and leisure businesses open from this weekend, everybody must follow the COVID-19 Secure guidelines wherever they are to protect themselves and others. https://t.co/KWS0AidQE6
english: Today I spoke to business leaders who are supporting the government's #EnjoySummerSafely campaign.   As more hospitality and leisure businesses open from this weekend, everybody must follow the COVID-19 Secure guidelines wherever they are to protect themselves and others. https://t.co/KWS0AidQE6

text: Earlier this week, I was honoured to speak to members of the ambulance service in the North East about how they have responded to the coronavirus pandemic. Thank you all, so much, for your work throughout the pandemic. https://t.co/EGVJqO9e9q
english: Earlier this week, I was honoured to speak to members of the ambulance service in the North East about how they have responded to the coronavirus pandemic. Thank you all, so much, for your work throughout the pandemic. https://t.co/EGVJqO9e9q

text: We are committed not only to defeating coronavirus, but also to tackling the great unresolved challenges of our time.    To build more homes, invest in our NHS, schools & police, and to mend the gap in opportunity, productivity and connectivity between the regions of the UK.
english: We are committed not only to defeating coronavirus, but also to tackling the great unresolved challenges of our time.    To build more homes, invest in our NHS, schools & police, and to mend the gap in opportunity, productivity and connectivity between the regions of the UK.

text: The NHS represents the very best of us, and we will always be there to support it. https://t.co/a8mIq0LtPi
english: The NHS represents the very best of us, and we will always be there to support it. https://t.co/a8mIq0LtPi

text: We have a mission to unite and to level up our country, by getting people back into work and getting the virus under control. https://t.co/2mgoqeaGRK
english: We have a mission to unite and to level up our country, by getting people back into work and getting the virus under control. https://t.co/2mgoqeaGRK

text: We’re investing an additional £14bn in schools and launching a ten year school building programme, so that every child can receive a fantastic education and opportunities to succeed. https://t.co/vXJ5l62izL
english: We’re investing an additional £14bn in schools and launching a ten year school building programme, so that every child can receive a fantastic education and opportunities to succeed. https://t.co/vXJ5l62izL

text: This is the moment to be ambitious, to believe in Britain and to rise to the scale of the challenge and the opportunity.  https://t.co/SLMle6g5jg
english: This is the moment to be ambitious, to believe in Britain and to rise to the scale of the challenge and the opportunity.  https://t.co/SLMle6g5jg

text: We will build the foundations now for future prosperity, to make this country the best place in the world to live  https://t.co/pItk3ZoX7a
english: We will build the foundations now for future prosperity, to make this country the best place in the world to live  https://t.co/pItk3ZoX7a

text: Too many parts of this country have felt left behind.   I want you to know that this government is on your side, and we have a plan to unite and level up the whole country. https://t.co/w80w3wY278
english: Too many parts of this country have felt left behind.   I want you to know that this government is on your side, and we have a plan to unite and level up the whole country. https://t.co/w80w3wY278

text: Today I have set out a new deal for Britain, to deliver jobs, skills and infrastructure.   Read more here: https://t.co/5jtpvevPh8 https://t.co/IlbKknBisx
english: Today I have set out a new deal for Britain, to deliver jobs, skills and infrastructure.   Read more here: https://t.co/5jtpvevPh8 https://t.co/IlbKknBisx

text: I've just spoken with Sir Peter Soulsby, Mayor of Leicester, on the response to the local outbreak.   We've agreed to stay in close contact as we monitor the situation & I want to thank the people of Leicester for their forbearance which is vital in controlling the virus.
english: I've just spoken with Sir Peter Soulsby, Mayor of Leicester, on the response to the local outbreak.   We've agreed to stay in close contact as we monitor the situation & I want to thank the people of Leicester for their forbearance which is vital in controlling the virus.

text: As we bounce back from the pandemic, it’s important we lay the foundations for a country where everyone has the opportunity to succeed.  This £1 billion investment will make sure our schools and colleges are fit for the future, with better facilities and brand new buildings. https://t.co/OJSJ2Otuat
english: As we bounce back from the pandemic, it’s important we lay the foundations for a country where everyone has the opportunity to succeed.  This £1 billion investment will make sure our schools and colleges are fit for the future, with better facilities and brand new buildings. https://t.co/OJSJ2Otuat

text: Earlier this week, I visited Pizza Pilgrims with Chancellor @RishiSunak, to see first-hand the measures they are putting in place to protect customers and staff from coronavirus. https://t.co/ocp9wQMQAg
english: Earlier this week, I visited Pizza Pilgrims with Chancellor @RishiSunak, to see first-hand the measures they are putting in place to protect customers and staff from coronavirus. https://t.co/ocp9wQMQAg

text: We want to build our way back to health. If Covid was a lightning flash, we’re about to have the thunderclap of the economic consequences.  We’re going to be ready.  Read my full interview with The Mail on Sunday here: https://t.co/DX9tIURqKI https://t.co/y0mUpgCJru
english: We want to build our way back to health. If Covid was a lightning flash, we’re about to have the thunderclap of the economic consequences.  We’re going to be ready.  Read my full interview with The Mail on Sunday here: https://t.co/DX9tIURqKI https://t.co/y0mUpgCJru

text: Whilst we have been able to carefully ease some restrictions, we must #StayAlert to the very real risks of coronavirus.   I would urge everyone to please remain vigilant this weekend and stick to the social distancing guidelines. If we let our guard down, cases will rise.
english: Whilst we have been able to carefully ease some restrictions, we must #StayAlert to the very real risks of coronavirus.   I would urge everyone to please remain vigilant this weekend and stick to the social distancing guidelines. If we let our guard down, cases will rise.

text: While nothing can properly mirror the joy of Pride celebrations in our towns and cities, #GlobalPride is a unique opportunity for people to connect with one another, in unity, across all nations. I send my best wishes to all in the LGBT community celebrating today.
english: While nothing can properly mirror the joy of Pride celebrations in our towns and cities, #GlobalPride is a unique opportunity for people to connect with one another, in unity, across all nations. I send my best wishes to all in the LGBT community celebrating today.

text: Businesses all over the country are getting ready to open their doors again on the 4 July.   Yesterday I heard from @PizzaPilgrims staff about how they’re making their restaurant COVID-19 Secure so customers can enjoy their pizza safely. https://t.co/19B4xd3KtX
english: Businesses all over the country are getting ready to open their doors again on the 4 July.   Yesterday I heard from @PizzaPilgrims staff about how they’re making their restaurant COVID-19 Secure so customers can enjoy their pizza safely. https://t.co/19B4xd3KtX

text: We proudly salute our Armed Forces   #ArmedForcesDay https://t.co/Z5TrDKB3BS
english: We proudly salute our Armed Forces   #ArmedForcesDay https://t.co/Z5TrDKB3BS

text: Congratulations to Ireland  on forming a new Government and to @MichealMartinTD on becoming Taoiseach. Ireland is our closest neighbour, good friend and ally on issues such as climate change, the global fight against Covid-19 and our shared values on human rights and democracy.
english: Congratulations to Ireland  on forming a new Government and to @MichealMartinTD on becoming Taoiseach. Ireland is our closest neighbour, good friend and ally on issues such as climate change, the global fight against Covid-19 and our shared values on human rights and democracy.

text: Deeply saddened by the terrible incident in Glasgow, my thoughts are with all the victims and their families.   Thank you to our brave emergency services who are responding.
english: Deeply saddened by the terrible incident in Glasgow, my thoughts are with all the victims and their families.   Thank you to our brave emergency services who are responding.

text: From today, you can see all the data we used to present at the press conferences on the new public dashboard here. This will be updated daily.   https://t.co/9A69662pCv
english: From today, you can see all the data we used to present at the press conferences on the new public dashboard here. This will be updated daily.   https://t.co/9A69662pCv

text: Fantastic news that we are recruiting so many more doctors and nurses to our NHS.   There are now 6,000 more doctors than a year ago, and 12,000 more nurses.
english: Fantastic news that we are recruiting so many more doctors and nurses to our NHS.   There are now 6,000 more doctors than a year ago, and 12,000 more nurses.

text: The government has asked a huge amount of all of you, and you have met that challenge with good humour and common sense.   Of course, the fight is far from over. We must all continue to stay alert to the risk of infection, and maintain social distancing. https://t.co/Jb6ZVZPzfz
english: The government has asked a huge amount of all of you, and you have met that challenge with good humour and common sense.   Of course, the fight is far from over. We must all continue to stay alert to the risk of infection, and maintain social distancing. https://t.co/Jb6ZVZPzfz

text: From July 4 in England, pubs, restaurants, hair salons, and many other businesses will be allowed to reopen - provided they can do so in a way that is COVID-secure, keeping customers and staff safe. https://t.co/L9ZqCZCnBP
english: From July 4 in England, pubs, restaurants, hair salons, and many other businesses will be allowed to reopen - provided they can do so in a way that is COVID-secure, keeping customers and staff safe. https://t.co/L9ZqCZCnBP

text: From 4 July, your household will be able to meet with one other household at a time, including staying over. You should still remain socially distant from anyone outside your household.  #StayAlert https://t.co/SSJe5SkakU
english: From 4 July, your household will be able to meet with one other household at a time, including staying over. You should still remain socially distant from anyone outside your household.  #StayAlert https://t.co/SSJe5SkakU

text: From July 4, we will move from 2 metres to ‘1 metre plus’. This means staying one metre apart, plus mitigations which reduce the risk of transmission.   #StayAlert https://t.co/a8W6B841MY
english: From July 4, we will move from 2 metres to ‘1 metre plus’. This means staying one metre apart, plus mitigations which reduce the risk of transmission.   #StayAlert https://t.co/a8W6B841MY

text: From 4 July we will be easing some restrictions in England. Where it’s not possible to stay two metres apart, people will be advised to keep one metre apart plus mitigations, such as wearing a face covering or ensuring you face away from others. https://t.co/zWw2Po7BBO
english: From 4 July we will be easing some restrictions in England. Where it’s not possible to stay two metres apart, people will be advised to keep one metre apart plus mitigations, such as wearing a face covering or ensuring you face away from others. https://t.co/zWw2Po7BBO

text: I was honoured to meet with members of Britain’s Caribbean Community at Downing Street today, on the 72nd anniversary of the arrival of the Empire Windrush to Britain.   #WindrushDay https://t.co/g8tnPpYlE3
english: I was honoured to meet with members of Britain’s Caribbean Community at Downing Street today, on the 72nd anniversary of the arrival of the Empire Windrush to Britain.   #WindrushDay https://t.co/g8tnPpYlE3

text: 72 years ago today the Windrush generation began to arrive in the UK. They contributed greatly to rebuilding post-war Britain.  Today we celebrate members of the Windrush generation and their descendants, and their fantastic contribution to Britain. #WindrushDay
english: 72 years ago today the Windrush generation began to arrive in the UK. They contributed greatly to rebuilding post-war Britain.  Today we celebrate members of the Windrush generation and their descendants, and their fantastic contribution to Britain. #WindrushDay

text: I’m appalled and sickened that people should lose their lives in this way. Our thoughts are with the families and friends of the victims.   Thank you to Thames Valley Police for their bravery in tackling the suspect. https://t.co/BWgyODoIWM
english: I’m appalled and sickened that people should lose their lives in this way. Our thoughts are with the families and friends of the victims.   Thank you to Thames Valley Police for their bravery in tackling the suspect. https://t.co/BWgyODoIWM

text: My thoughts are with all of those affected by the appalling incident in Reading and my thanks to the emergency services on the scene.
english: My thoughts are with all of those affected by the appalling incident in Reading and my thanks to the emergency services on the scene.

text: It was fantastic to answer the questions of children at Bovingdon Primary Academy yesterday, and talk to them about the government’s new £1 billion fund to support schools and children across England. https://t.co/hNcjS2MfnU
english: It was fantastic to answer the questions of children at Bovingdon Primary Academy yesterday, and talk to them about the government’s new £1 billion fund to support schools and children across England. https://t.co/hNcjS2MfnU

text: Earlier today I went to Bovingdon Academy to see how they are safely getting kids back into school.  Our £1 billion fund is going to help schools catch up and bounce forward when all schools come back in September. https://t.co/PwdAFgwHgQ
english: Earlier today I went to Bovingdon Academy to see how they are safely getting kids back into school.  Our £1 billion fund is going to help schools catch up and bounce forward when all schools come back in September. https://t.co/PwdAFgwHgQ

text: Aujourd'hui, j’ai accueilli @EmmanuelMacron à @10DowningStreet pour le 80e anniversaire de l’appel du général Charles de Gaulle du 18 juin. Nous n'oublierons jamais les sacrifices faits pour notre liberté.   Nos pays seront à jamais voisins et amis, unis par nos valeurs communes. https://t.co/C53NEWf4Lh
english: Today, I welcomed @emmanuelmacron to @ 10downingstreet for the 80th anniversary of the call of General Charles de Gaulle from June 18th. We will never forget the sacrifices made for our freedom. Our countries will forever be neighbors and friends, united by our common values. https://t.co/c53newf4lh

text: Today I hosted @EmmanuelMacron at @10DowningStreet for the 80th anniversary of General Charles de Gaulle’s Appeal of 18 June. We will never forget the sacrifices that were made for our freedom.   Our countries will forever be neighbours and friends, united by our shared values. https://t.co/UgZS674M7B
english: Today I hosted @EmmanuelMacron at @10DowningStreet for the 80th anniversary of General Charles de Gaulle’s Appeal of 18 June. We will never forget the sacrifices that were made for our freedom.   Our countries will forever be neighbours and friends, united by our shared values. https://t.co/UgZS674M7B

text: Welcome to Downing Street, President @EmmanuelMacron  https://t.co/epDbsYlvM4
english: Welcome to Downing Street, President @EmmanuelMacron  https://t.co/epDbsYlvM4

text: Thank you to all the fantastic NHS staff I spoke to from Charing Cross Hospital, for all you have done throughout the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/VIVLCZB837
english: Thank you to all the fantastic NHS staff I spoke to from Charing Cross Hospital, for all you have done throughout the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/VIVLCZB837

text: Dame Vera Lynn’s charm and magical voice entranced and uplifted our country in some of our darkest hours. Her voice will live on to lift the hearts of generations to come.
english: Dame Vera Lynn’s charm and magical voice entranced and uplifted our country in some of our darkest hours. Her voice will live on to lift the hearts of generations to come.

text: Earlier this week, I was delighted to have an insightful conversation with staff at Charing Cross Hospital. Thank you for all your hard work during this pandemic, and for all that you do to save lives and care for others in need.   #ThankYouNHS https://t.co/XVodDucAzF
english: Earlier this week, I was delighted to have an insightful conversation with staff at Charing Cross Hospital. Thank you for all your hard work during this pandemic, and for all that you do to save lives and care for others in need.   #ThankYouNHS https://t.co/XVodDucAzF

text: The four men we are honouring today – Pierre, Edgard, Daniel and Hubert – symbolise the enduring depth and strength of the friendship between the UK and France. They are heroes who defended us and the whole world from fascism. https://t.co/GX5LVLfpHH
english: The four men we are honouring today – Pierre, Edgard, Daniel and Hubert – symbolise the enduring depth and strength of the friendship between the UK and France. They are heroes who defended us and the whole world from fascism. https://t.co/GX5LVLfpHH

text: I’m proud to call the United Kingdom a friend of New Zealand, and am thrilled that we now have the opportunity to strengthen our alliance by negotiating a new free trade agreement.  https://t.co/OVMilbAq4G
english: I’m proud to call the United Kingdom a friend of New Zealand, and am thrilled that we now have the opportunity to strengthen our alliance by negotiating a new free trade agreement.  https://t.co/OVMilbAq4G

text: There are few countries in the world who share a closer friendship than Australia and the UK.   Now, as an independent trading nation for the first time in decades, we have the opportunity to turn our shared history and friendship into a world-leading free trade agreement.  https://t.co/PPWESs3aHq
english: There are few countries in the world who share a closer friendship than Australia and the UK.   Now, as an independent trading nation for the first time in decades, we have the opportunity to turn our shared history and friendship into a world-leading free trade agreement.  https://t.co/PPWESs3aHq

text: I know that the lockdown restrictions have been difficult, and that many will be suffering from loneliness and feelings of isolation.   If you know someone who may be alone at this time, give them a call and let them know that you care.  #LonelinessAwarenessWeek (1/2)
english: I know that the lockdown restrictions have been difficult, and that many will be suffering from loneliness and feelings of isolation.   If you know someone who may be alone at this time, give them a call and let them know that you care.  #LonelinessAwarenessWeek (1/2)

text: I was delighted to meet those working at Westfield shopping centre, Stratford, where I saw adjustments being made to ensure customers can shop safely.   This week, as shops start reopening in England, remember to follow social distancing rules to protect yourself and others. https://t.co/uAhZm7yxSt
english: I was delighted to meet those working at Westfield shopping centre, Stratford, where I saw adjustments being made to ensure customers can shop safely.   This week, as shops start reopening in England, remember to follow social distancing rules to protect yourself and others. https://t.co/uAhZm7yxSt

text: Today I visited Westfield shopping centre in east London, to meet some of the people who work there. They've been working very hard to get ready to reopen tomorrow when we're hoping people will return to the shops. https://t.co/yx7QDKFm08
english: Today I visited Westfield shopping centre in east London, to meet some of the people who work there. They've been working very hard to get ready to reopen tomorrow when we're hoping people will return to the shops. https://t.co/yx7QDKFm08

text: While those affected by Grenfell are not able to gather in person, I want you to know that all of us in this country are with you in spirit.   I remain absolutely committed to uncovering the causes of this tragedy, and ensuring it is never repeated. https://t.co/m2ZwpEZnLB
english: While those affected by Grenfell are not able to gather in person, I want you to know that all of us in this country are with you in spirit.   I remain absolutely committed to uncovering the causes of this tragedy, and ensuring it is never repeated. https://t.co/m2ZwpEZnLB

text: Racist thuggery has no place on our streets. Anyone attacking the police will be met with full force of the law. These marches & protests have been subverted by violence and breach current guidelines. Racism has no part in the UK and we must work together to make that a reality.
english: Racist thuggery has no place on our streets. Anyone attacking the police will be met with full force of the law. These marches & protests have been subverted by violence and breach current guidelines. Racism has no part in the UK and we must work together to make that a reality.

text: The statue of Winston Churchill in Parliament Square is a permanent reminder of his achievement in saving this country – and the whole of Europe – from a fascist and racist tyranny. 1/8
english: The statue of Winston Churchill in Parliament Square is a permanent reminder of his achievement in saving this country – and the whole of Europe – from a fascist and racist tyranny. 1/8

text: From this weekend, single adult households, including single parents with children under 18, can form a support bubble with one other household.   We are making this intervention so that those who have been living alone for a long time can reconnect with loved ones. https://t.co/1OlJXGmUJb
english: From this weekend, single adult households, including single parents with children under 18, can form a support bubble with one other household.   We are making this intervention so that those who have been living alone for a long time can reconnect with loved ones. https://t.co/1OlJXGmUJb

text: Earlier this week I spoke to members of staff at Foxholes Care Home in Hertfordshire, to thank them all for their work throughout the coronavirus pandemic and beyond.   #CarersWeek https://t.co/vKCr9pYwMO
english: Earlier this week I spoke to members of staff at Foxholes Care Home in Hertfordshire, to thank them all for their work throughout the coronavirus pandemic and beyond.   #CarersWeek https://t.co/vKCr9pYwMO

text: We must all continue to remember those on the frontline battling this disease, and members of society who are vulnerable - and continue to do all we can to stop the spread of coronavirus.    By doing the right thing and following the rules, you are helping to save lives.
english: We must all continue to remember those on the frontline battling this disease, and members of society who are vulnerable - and continue to do all we can to stop the spread of coronavirus.    By doing the right thing and following the rules, you are helping to save lives.

text: I want to say thank you, from the bottom of my heart, to all carers in the UK helping us through this pandemic.    Whether you work as a carer, or are caring for someone at home, your compassion and strength at this time is a beacon of hope for us all.     #CarersWeek
english: I want to say thank you, from the bottom of my heart, to all carers in the UK helping us through this pandemic.    Whether you work as a carer, or are caring for someone at home, your compassion and strength at this time is a beacon of hope for us all.     #CarersWeek

text: Let us work peacefully and lawfully to defeat racism and discrimination wherever we find it, and let us continue to work together as we put Britain back on its feet. https://t.co/onUqXbcCGB
english: Let us work peacefully and lawfully to defeat racism and discrimination wherever we find it, and let us continue to work together as we put Britain back on its feet. https://t.co/onUqXbcCGB

text: People have a right to protest peacefully & while observing social distancing but they have no right to attack the police. These demonstrations have been subverted by thuggery - and they are a betrayal of the cause they purport to serve. Those responsible will be held to account.
english: People have a right to protest peacefully & while observing social distancing but they have no right to attack the police. These demonstrations have been subverted by thuggery - and they are a betrayal of the cause they purport to serve. Those responsible will be held to account.

text: Together we have made it through the peak, but we’re not yet back to normal.  Please continue to #StayAlert, keep 2 metres away from others and wash your hands regularly.   If you have symptoms of coronavirus, self-isolate and apply for a home testing kit: https://t.co/47UIkaqYa0 https://t.co/7icCNU99wK
english: Together we have made it through the peak, but we’re not yet back to normal.  Please continue to #StayAlert, keep 2 metres away from others and wash your hands regularly.   If you have symptoms of coronavirus, self-isolate and apply for a home testing kit: https://t.co/47UIkaqYa0 https://t.co/7icCNU99wK

text: We all have a part to play in stopping the spread of coronavirus.   Let’s continue to take extra care by keeping 2 metres apart and washing our hands regularly.   #StayAlert https://t.co/LmeSUZqIyP
english: We all have a part to play in stopping the spread of coronavirus.   Let’s continue to take extra care by keeping 2 metres apart and washing our hands regularly.   #StayAlert https://t.co/LmeSUZqIyP

text: The virus spreads more easily indoors, so if you are meeting others today, stay outside and keep 2 metres away at all times. https://t.co/mUSgo595gQ
english: The virus spreads more easily indoors, so if you are meeting others today, stay outside and keep 2 metres away at all times. https://t.co/mUSgo595gQ

text: We all need to #StayAlert, act responsibly, and strictly observe social distancing rules.   Do not meet others inside your home. Stay outdoors, keep 2 metres apart, and wash your hands regularly. https://t.co/Vb0VWPj9jE
english: We all need to #StayAlert, act responsibly, and strictly observe social distancing rules.   Do not meet others inside your home. Stay outdoors, keep 2 metres apart, and wash your hands regularly. https://t.co/Vb0VWPj9jE

text: If you are contacted by an NHS contact tracer who tells you that you have been in contact with someone who has tested positive for coronavirus, you must self-isolate for 14 days.  If everyone follows these guidelines, we can control the virus, protect our NHS and save lives. https://t.co/ipRa91AU2t

text: Today I am thinking of the men who landed on the beaches of Normandy 76 years ago, who fought and died so that we can be free from the evils of fascism.   We will always be grateful for their courage, and we will always remember their sacrifice.  #DDay76 #DDay https://t.co/a7WgvK6s8j
english: Today I am thinking of the men who landed on the beaches of Normandy 76 years ago, who fought and died so that we can be free from the evils of fascism.   We will always be grateful for their courage, and we will always remember their sacrifice.  #DDay76 #DDay https://t.co/a7WgvK6s8j

text: Thank you for all you have been doing to fight the spread of this virus, and to protect our NHS.   We can beat this together. https://t.co/gXdlVGsxyc
english: Thank you for all you have been doing to fight the spread of this virus, and to protect our NHS.   We can beat this together. https://t.co/gXdlVGsxyc

text: If you have coronavirus symptoms (a high temperature, a new continuous cough, or a loss or change to sense of taste or smell) you need to self-isolate and get tested.  There is plenty of capacity and anyone with symptoms is eligible. Order a test from https://t.co/47UIka9nis 1/2
english: If you have coronavirus symptoms (a high temperature, a new continuous cough, or a loss or change to sense of taste or smell) you need to self-isolate and get tested.  There is plenty of capacity and anyone with symptoms is eligible. Order a test from https://t.co/47UIka9nis 1/2

text: Whilst we are all rightly focused on beating coronavirus, we cannot lose sight of the need to protect our people and our planet from the devastating threat of climate change and biodiversity loss if nothing is done. 1/4
english: Whilst we are all rightly focused on beating coronavirus, we cannot lose sight of the need to protect our people and our planet from the devastating threat of climate change and biodiversity loss if nothing is done. 1/4

text: 1/2: It was a privilege to host yesterday’s Global Vaccine Summit, bringing together countries to vaccinate against the world’s deadliest diseases. The Summit has raised an incredible $8.8bn for @Gavi. https://t.co/9ub6kaviuf
english: 1/2: It was a privilege to host yesterday’s Global Vaccine Summit, bringing together countries to vaccinate against the world’s deadliest diseases. The Summit has raised an incredible $8.8bn for @Gavi. https://t.co/9ub6kaviuf

english: Let’s continue to fight this virus by staying alert, keeping 2 metres away from others, and regularly washing our hands.    #StayAlert https://t.co/mC0WZXec6B

text: Today I call on countries to back @Gavi, the Global Vaccine Alliance.   Let’s fortify this lifesaving alliance and inaugurate a new era of global health co-operation, which I believe is now the most essential shared endeavour of our lifetimes. https://t.co/mCC8rKYcO8
english: Today I call on countries to back @Gavi, the Global Vaccine Alliance.   Let’s fortify this lifesaving alliance and inaugurate a new era of global health co-operation, which I believe is now the most essential shared endeavour of our lifetimes. https://t.co/mCC8rKYcO8

text: We all have a role to play in beating this virus. Thank you for all that you are doing.   #StayAlert https://t.co/lPhIojTnp4

text: During #VolunteersWeek I want to say a big thank you to all the volunteers across the UK.    Whether you’ve helped a neighbour with their shopping, or delivered supplies to local hospitals, your kindness and compassion has been admired by us all.   Keep going, and thank you. https://t.co/Yjt7Qt03Wk

text: At the start of #PrideMonth, I want to thank those in the LGBT community and campaigners for their inspirational work, in fighting tirelessly to overcome the prejudices many face.   Your contribution has helped shape a better future for people in the UK and around the world.
english: At the start of #PrideMonth, I want to thank those in the LGBT community and campaigners for their inspirational work, in fighting tirelessly to overcome the prejudices many face.   Your contribution has helped shape a better future for people in the UK and around the world.

text: As we begin to ease some restrictions in England today, it’s important that we all #StayAlert to the risk of coronavirus.    Remember to wash your hands, stay 2 metres apart, and if you have symptoms, self-isolate and get tested. https://t.co/0N6PNC4wsZ

text: From today, in England, you will be allowed to meet up to five friends in public outdoor places or in your garden. This will be a moment of joy and relief for many.   Please remember to keep 2 metres away from those you don’t live with, and wash your hands regularly.
english: From today, in England, you will be allowed to meet up to five friends in public outdoor places or in your garden. This will be a moment of joy and relief for many.   Please remember to keep 2 metres away from those you don’t live with, and wash your hands regularly.

text: I know many of you will be enjoying the warmer weather today.    If you’re out exercising or meeting a friend, remember to stay 2 metres apart and wash your hands regularly.   #StayAlert https://t.co/DXMbvX8hFn

text: Seven years on from his murder on a London street, we remember Fusilier Lee Rigby. On this sad day, my thoughts are with his family, friends and colleagues.
english: Seven years on from his murder on a London street, we remember Fusilier Lee Rigby. On this sad day, my thoughts are with his family, friends and colleagues.

text: It’s so important we all continue to stay alert and follow the rules.   Keep 2 metres from others. Wash your hands regularly. text: Today, on the third anniversary of the Manchester Arena attack, we remember the 22 lives which were so cruelly taken. My thoughts are with all of those grieving for the loss of their loved ones.
english: Today, on the third anniversary of the Manchester Arena attack, we remember the 22 lives which were so cruelly taken. My thoughts are with all of those grieving for the loss of their loved ones.

text: Yesterday I hosted the Hidden Harms Summit at 10 Downing Street, to discuss how we can tackle crimes like domestic abuse and modern slavery. https://t.co/h2lsk3FWhW
english: Yesterday I hosted the Hidden Harms Summit at 10 Downing Street, to discuss how we can tackle crimes like domestic abuse and modern slavery. https://t.co/h2lsk3FWhW

text: I know this has been a tough time for so many people. Thank you for all of the sacrifices you have made.   We are past the peak, and I’m confident that if we continue to follow the rules and work together, we will beat this virus and be reunited with our friends and family soon.

text: I can confirm that we are past the peak of this disease.   We are past the peak and we are on the downward slope.   And we have so many reasons to be hopeful for the long term.   But we can only defeat coronavirus by our collective discipline and working together.
english: I can confirm that we are past the peak of this disease.   We are past the peak and we are on the downward slope.   And we have so many reasons to be hopeful for the long term.   But we can only defeat coronavirus by our collective discipline and working together.

english: 1/3: I know how hard and how stressful it has been to give up even temporarily those ancient and basic freedoms, not seeing friends, not seeing loved ones, working from home, managing the kids, worrying about your job and your firm.

english: I have just spoken to @Keir_Starmer & congratulated him on becoming Labour leader. We agreed on the importance of all party leaders continuing to work constructively together through this national emergency. I have invited him and other opposition leaders to a briefing next week.

text: This country has made a huge effort, a huge sacrifice, and done absolutely brilliantly well in delaying the spread of the virus.   But in this fine weather, please don't be tempted to break the regulations. I urge everyone to stay at home, protect the NHS and save lives.
english: This country has made a huge effort, a huge sacrifice, and done absolutely brilliantly well in delaying the spread of the virus.   But in this fine weather, please don't be tempted to break the regulations. I urge everyone to stay at home, protect the NHS and save lives.

text: If I become PM, we will have 20,000 more police officers on the beat. We want to keep the number of police officers high and we need to keep visible frontline policing. That’s what we did in London and that’s what I want to do for Britain  https://t.co/HAp8RAMynV
